title: Zarosian Empire

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Zarosian Empire was a vast ancient empire that covered the territories of where Misthalin, Asgarnia, the Wilderness, and northern Morytania now stand. It was a predominant force during the Second and Third Age. After attempts by Saradomin and Zamorak to remove all traces of the empire after its fall, only buried ruins remain as evidence of its existence.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Zarosian Empire
Zarosian Empire
Released9 July 2003 (Update)
Also calledThe Fallen Empire[1]
MembersNo
CapitalSenntisten
InhabitantsMahjarrat, Humans, Vampyres, Demons, Dragon riders
Advanced data
Typeregion

The Zarosian Empire was a vast ancient empire that covered the territories of where Misthalin, Asgarnia, the Wilderness, and northern Morytania now stand. It was a predominant force during the Second and Third Age. After attempts by Saradomin and Zamorak to remove all traces of the empire after its fall, only buried ruins remain as evidence of its existence.

The empire was ruled by the god Zaros himself at the capital city of Senntisten which was located east of where Varrock stands today. Archaeological discoveries by the end of the Fifth Age spurred interest in Zarosian history and culture.


Settlements[edit | edit source]

  • Senntisten (Capital city)
  • Annakarl
  • Carralangar
  • Dareeyak
  • Ghorrock
  • Kharyrll
  • Lassar
  • Paddewwa
  • Viggora's Fortress
  1. ^ The Great Guardian, Old School RuneScape. "Many sought to claim this artefact for themselves, including servants of the Fallen Empire."

[[File:Ancient talisman detail.png|100px|left]]
The '''Zarosian Empire''' was a vast ancient empire that covered the territories of where [[Misthalin]], [[Asgarnia]], the [[Wilderness]], and northern [[Morytania]] now stand. It was a predominant force during the [[Second Age|Second]] and [[Third Age]]. After attempts by [[Saradomin]] and [[Zamorak]] to remove all traces of the empire after its fall, only buried ruins remain as evidence of its existence.

The empire was ruled by the god [[Zaros]] himself at the capital city of [[Senntisten]] which was located east of where [[Varrock]] stands today. Archaeological discoveries by the end of the [[Fifth Age]] spurred interest in Zarosian history and culture.
